image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Cedar Rapids, Linn County, Iowa, March 2, 1959; B.S.S., Cornell College, Mount Vernon, Iowa, 1981; M.A., University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyo., 1983; Ph.D., University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr.,1993; United States Navy Reserve, 1995 to present; professor; intelligence analyst; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.

asset.name: C001065_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Carney, Christopher Paul. "International Patron-Cliency; A New Framework for Old Questions: The Case of U. S. Aid," Ph. D. Diss., University of Nebraska, 1993.
